capital gains tax.translation[0].definit: a tax that you pay on profits that you make when you sell your possessions
capital gains tax.translation[1].definit: in Britain, a tax that ordinary people, not companies, pay when they make a large amount of money by selling an asset such as property. In the US, capital gains tax is also paid by companies
UK pension funds are exempt from both capital gains tax and income tax on their investments.
